column4: hi friends!, I just installed Feisty (fresh install since I didn't have patience to wait for apt to be stable again)... now I got everything running except my wireless (broadcom) I blacklisted BCM43xx then installed ndiswrapper and used it to install the 64bit version of my bcmwl5.inf... now i see the networks and when i try to connect it detects the right security and EVERYTHING SEEMS LIKE it's working perfect but as soon as I c
lick the connect button... the connection doesn't connect, it goes back to my wired connection right away without any error messages or whatever
You want to have two connections at the same time?
johnnybuoy... no it just doesn't connect to the wireless (I also tried disabling my wired)
did you try unplugging the wire from the NIC and then trying to connect to wireless?
I tried unplugging the wire AND disabling the nic
hmmm
so it shows then networks but it can't associate, or it shows the networks, associates and doesn't get an IP?

something like that... it asks for my WPA password and then i put it in... it tries to connect but doesn't and doesn't give an IP... i tried to switch my router to WEP or even NO security... everything failed
!ndiswrapper
do you have a 64bit version of feisty?
yup and I got the 64bit version of my drivers in ndiswrapper
does the bcm43xx driver not work? did you try it?
bcm43xx doesn't work for anyone with my model :P
ah!
can you paste the lspci line of the wireless card?
03:02.0 Network controller: Broadcom Corporation BCM4318 [AirForce One 54g]  802.11g Wireless LAN Controller (rev 02)
plz try this howto: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=185174 , I also understand that your card doesn't work with that driver, I'm checking
it says Follow these steps to get your wireless card working under ubuntu dapper 6.06:
and johnnybuoy I have just a out of topic question... is your nickname referring to some kind of quebec's stupid video series?
yes, but this hasn't changed much since
anyway, here is an ndiswrapper howto also: http://www.debiantutorials.org/content/view/153/213/
well thanks a lot i'll try those... you go check out : http://tetesaclaques.tv/video.php?vid=7
